justifications: The process of buying a property is unchanged. The cost of purchase is the same regardless of nationality and remains amongst the lowest in Europe.
There is no difference to Capital Gains Tax which currently has a basic rate of 34.5% (19% + 15.5% social charges) regardless of nationality.
The annual taxe fonciere (paying towards local services) and taxe d'habitation (paying for residency, including TV licence) are not affected.
The UK Government has said that you can use your current EHIC card until it expires.
If you do not hold an EHIC card you can apply for the new Global Health Insurance Card (GHIC) here.
Once you are registered to live in France you can apply for a Carte Vitale which covers your healthcare.

references: Visa de Long Sejour Temporaire Visiteur

justifications: The big change is that visitors may stay for only 90 days out of 180 days.
If you want to stay longer than 90 days you will need to apply for a Long Stay Visa.
as a holiday home owner you will probably apply for a Visa de Long Sejour Temporaire Visiteur.
Since you will be staying more than 90 days, you must apply for a long term visa before applying for a residency permit at your local Prefecture.
Then you can apply for a 5 year residency permit which will be exchanged for a permanent residency permit after 5 years.
